signature.textualDescription: PGP is a public key / private key encryption technology. Your public key is given out to people while your secret key (secring) is kept private. Encrypted communications can be decrypted by attackers who have your public key, secret key, and passphrase. This is why its extremely important to keep your secret key safe.
This directory listing might contain a potential password file.
This directory listing might contain a potential password file.
Looking for upload.asp. Upload.asp, if not protected might allow an attacker to upload malicious content to the server that might allow them to execute code.
Looks for at-admin.cgi. Used to administer a cgi server
Looks for global.inc. This file often contains remote administration information
Looking for guestbook.cgi. There are a number of vulnerabilities associated with this various freeware guestbook's.
Looking for frontpage extensions. There are a number of vulnerabilities associated with frontpage extensions.
This check looks for the Microsoft Data Access Components DLL. (msadcs.dll). the MDAC DLL has had multiple vulnerabilities associated with it.

signature.shortDescription: Log of user's command line history.
signature.textualDescription: This file contains a command history and would be particularly helpful to an attacker who is doing information gathering.

signature.shortDescription: Log of user's command line history.
signature.textualDescription: This file contains a command history and would be particularly helpful to an attacker who is doing information gathering.

signature.shortDescription: Encoded usernames, passwords, and buddylist for Trillian users.
signature.textualDescription: Trillian is a multi-messaging client that supports AIM, MSN, Yahoo, IRC, and ICQ. The trillian.ini file contain's encoded passwords, usernames, buddy lists.

signature.querystring: "Select a database to view" intitle:"filemaker pro"
signature.shortDescription: Server providing access to Filemaker pro
signature.textualDescription: This search locates servers which provides access to Filemaker pro databases via the web. The severity of this search varies wildly depending on the security of the database itself

signature.shortDescription: Web facing admin interface to osCommerce.
signature.textualDescription: Explore the admin interface of osCommerce e-commerce sites. Depending on how bad the setup of the web store is, web surfers can even Google their way into customer details and order status, all from the Google cache.

From phpmyadmin.net : "phpMyAdmin is a tool written in PHP intended to handle the administration of MySQL over the WWW." Great, easy to use, but lock it down! Things you can do include viewing MySQL runtime information and system variables, show processes, reloading MySQL, changing privileges, and modifying or exporting databases. Hacker-fodder for sure!

signature.querystring: intitle:"the page cannot be found" inetmgr
signature.textualDescription: IIS 4.0 servers. Old web hack.

signature.querystring: "supplied argument is not a valid MySQL result resource"
signature.shortDescription: Reveals real path names in webserver
signature.textualDescription: Reveals real path names in webserver

signature.shortDescription: SQL error that displays useful information
signature.textualDescription: This SQL error message can display the username, database, path names and partial SQL statements.
HTML files with .bak extension can be viewed as plain text.

signature.shortDescription: PHP files with .bak extension's can be viewed as plain text.
signature.textualDescription: PHP files with .bak extension's can be viewed as plain text.

signature.shortDescription: JSP files with .bak extension's can be viewed as plain text.
signature.textualDescription: JSP files with .bak extension's can be viewed as plain text.

signature.shortDescription: HTTP log's may reveal user names, IP addresses, and other data.
signature.textualDescription: HTTP log's may reveal user names, IP addresses, and other data.
Access to WS_FTP log files. WS_FTP log files may reveal hidden directories or files.
Access to services.pwd file. The file often contains username and passwords
This file contains a list of passwords, usernames and email addresses for shopping cart application and form DCForum and for DCShop.
config.php can sometimes be a configuration file containing both a username and a password information for a SQL database.

signature.shortDescription: Acess to etc directory that has password files
signature.textualDescription: This search looks for indexed /etc directories, where many many many types of password files and other config files can be found.

signature.shortDescription: Excel files with keywords username, password, and email
signature.textualDescription: This search looks for Microsoft Excel spreadsheets containing the words username, password and email. There may be a high number of flase positives for this one.
.htpasswd is the default file name for Apache basic authentication files. Htpasswd files contain usernames and crackable passwords for web pages and directories.
.htpasswd is the default file name for Apache basic authentication files. Htpasswd files contain usernames and crackable passwords for sites using basic authentication.

signature.shortDescription: Looks for backup copies of the htpasswd file.
signature.textualDescription: Looks for backup copies of the htpasswd file.
This file contains administrative user names and (weakly) encrypted password for Microsoft Front Page. The file should not be readble to the general public
This file contains usernames and encrypted passwords. Using John the ripper, an attacker can crack passwords and log into the system.
This file is the secret keyring for PGP encryption. With this file and the passphrase an attacker could decrypt communications.

signature.shortDescription: Access to cleartext usernames and password's.
signature.textualDescription: The config.php script can contain usernames and passwords.
"master.passwd" files which contain encrypted passwords which may look like this: "guest MMCHhvZ6ODgFo" Using the base64 decoder in Cain and Able (www.oxid.it) an attacker can easily decode this.

signature.shortDescription: Log of previously typed commands in mysql
signature.textualDescription: The .mysql_history file contains commands that were performed against a mysql database.

The EarlyImpact Productcart contains multiple vulnerabilites, which could exploited to allow an attacker to steal user credentials or mount other attacks. See http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9669 for more informationfor more information. Also see http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9677

signature.querystring: "Powered by mnoGoSearch - free web search engine software"
signature.textualDescription: According to http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9667, certain versions of mnGoSearch contain a buffer overflow vulnerability which allow an attacker to execute commands on the server.
This reveals mySQL database dumps. These database dumps list the structure and content of databases, which can reveal many different types of sensitive information.

signature.shortDescription: www statistics may contain email address of intranet users.
signature.textualDescription:
More www statistics on the web. This one is very nice.. Lots of directory info, and client access statistics, email addresses.. lots os good stuff.
You know, these are SOOO dangerous, especially if INTRANET users get logged... talk about mapping out an intranet quickly...
thanks, sac =)

This search yeids host vulnerability scanner reports, revealing potential vulnerabilities on hosts and networks. Even if some of the vulnerabilities have been fixed, information about the network/hosts can still be gleaned.
This search reveals chat logs. Depending on the contents of the logs, these files could contain just about anything!

signature.shortDescription: www statistics, may contain email address of intranet loggers
signature.textualDescription: www statistics publicly indexed on the web. This man contain directory info, client access statistics, and email addresses.

This search yeids ISS scan reports, revealing potential vulnerabilities on hosts and networks. Even if some of the vulnerabilities have been fixed, information about the network/hosts can still be gleaned.

This search yeids vulnerability scanner reports, revealing potential vulnerabilities on hosts and networks. Even if some of the vulnerabilities have been fixed, information about the network/hosts can still be gleaned.

The terms "not for distribution" and confidential indicate a sensitive document. Results vary wildly, but web-based documents are for public viewing, and should neither be considered confidential or private.
Website statistics may allow an an attacker to find hidden pages or directories.

signature.shortDescription: Searches for disallow tags meant for web crawlers
signature.textualDescription: The robots.txt file serves as a set of instructions for web crawlers. The "disallow" tag tells a web crawler where not to look.

After placing an order via the web, many sites provide a page containing the phrase "Thank you for your order" and provide a receipt for future reference. At the very least, these pages can provide insight into the structure of a web-based shop.

signature.shortDescription: Reveals nessus scan reports for vulnerabilities
signature.textualDescription: This search yeids nessus scan reports. Even if some of the vulnerabilities have been fixed, we can still gather valuable information about the network/hosts. This also works with ISS and any other vulnerability scanner which produces reports in html or text format.

signature.shortDescription: Reveals ISS scan reports for vulnerabilities
signature.textualDescription: This search yeids ISS scan reports, revealing potential vulnerabilities on hosts and networks. Even if some of the vulnerabilities have been fixed, information about the network/hosts can still be gleaned.
These are weblog generated statistics for web sites which may contain hidden directories and pages.

signature.shortDescription: cgiirc.config files man contain information useful to an attacker.
signature.textualDescription: cgiirc.config files man contain information useful to an attacker.

signature.shortDescription: cgiirc.config files man contain information useful to an attacker.
signature.textualDescription: This is another less reliable way of finding the cgiirc.config file. cgiirc.config files man contain information useful to an attacker.

signature.shortDescription: Excel sheet showing the finance information
signature.textualDescription: Excel sheet showing the finance information

signature.shortDescription: Excel sheet showing the finance information
signature.textualDescription: Excel sheet showing the finance information

signature.shortDescription: Reveals cluster reports, useful for fingerprinting
signature.textualDescription: These are server cluster reports, great for info gathering.

signature.shortDescription: Reveals administrative usernames and authorization file paths for Frontpage.
signature.textualDescription: Reveals administrative usernames and authorization file paths for Frontpage.
Possible password file.

The webalizer program shows web statistics for web servers. This information includes who is visiting the site, what pages they visit, error codes produced, filetypes hosted on the server, number of hits, referrers, exit pages, and more which can provide interesting information for an attacker.

These devices are running HP Insight Management Agents for Servers which "provide device information for all managed subsystems. Alerts are generated by SNMP traps." The information on these pages include server addresses and other assorted SNMP information.

This search can find administrative login pages. Not a vulnerability in and of itself, this query serves as a locator for administrative areas of a site. Further investigation of the surrounding directories can often reveal interesting information.
This is a very basic string found on directory listing pages which show the version of the Apache web server. Hackers can use this information to find vulnerable targets without querying the servers.

This search reveals potential location for mailbox files by keying on the Outlook Express cleanup.log file. In some cases, the data in this directory or file may be of a very personal nature and may include sent and received emails and archives of email data.
dead.letter contains the contents of unfinished emails created on the UNIX platform. Emails (finished or not) can contain sensitive information.

signature.shortDescription: Reveals potential location of mailbox files
signature.textualDescription: This search reveals potential location for mailbox files. In some cases, the data in this directory or file may be of a very personal nature and may include sent and received emails and archives of email data.

signature.shortDescription: Reveals potential location of mailbox files
signature.textualDescription: This search reveals potential location for mailbox files. In some cases, the data in this directory or file may be of a very personal nature and may include sent and received emails and archives of email data.

signature.shortDescription: ws_ftp.ini config files has usernames and passwords
signature.textualDescription: ws_ftp.ini is a configuration file for a popular FTP client that stores usernames, (weakly) encoded passwords, sites and directories that the user can store for later reference. These should not be on the web!
This search can find Excel spreadsheets in an administrative directory or of an administrative nature. Many times these documents contain sensitive information.

This search can find administrative login pages. This is not a vulnerability in and of itself, this query serves as a locator for administrative areas of a site. Further investigation of the surrounding directories can often reveal interesting information.

This is a common script for changing passwords. This doesn't actually reveal the password, but it provides great information about the security layout of a server. These links can be used to troll around a website.
From phpmyadmin.net : "phpMyAdmin is a tool written in PHP intended to handle the administration of MySQL over the WWW."
From phpmyadmin.net : "phpMyAdmin is a tool written in PHP intended to handle the administration of MySQL over the WWW."
This is your typical stats page listing referrers and top ips and such. This information can certainly be used to gather information about a site and its visitors.

signature.shortDescription: ipsec.conf file reveals what is protected
signature.textualDescription: The ipsec.conf may reveal information about freeswan VPN's.
The manpage for ipsec_secrets: "It is vital that these secrets be protected. The file should be owned by the super-user, and its permissions should be set to block all access by others."
The manpage for ipsec_secrets: "It is vital that these secrets be protected. The file should be owned by the super-user, and its permissions should be set to block all access by others."

signature.shortDescription: check other files in the same directory
phpinfo.php has lots of useful information
signature.textualDescription: "phpinfo.php" files contain system versioning, SSL version, sendmail version and path, ftp, LDAP, SQL info, and Apache mods.
Reveals phpMyAdmin SQL information.
Reveals accessibility to phpMyAdmin tool

signature.shortDescription: File provides pointers to restricted files/directories
signature.textualDescription: The robots.txt file contains "rules" about where web spiders are allowed (and NOT allowed) to look in a website's directory structure. Without over-complicating things, this means that the robots.txt file gives a mini-roadmap of what's somewhat public and what's considered more private on a web site.
Potential exposure of student names, Grades, and SSN's.
Raw SQL dumps may provide information to an attacker.

signature.querystring: "cacheserverreport for" "This analysis was produced by calamaris"
signature.textualDescription: Web proxy logs may log sensitive information.
These lock files often contain usernames of the user that has locked the file. Username harvesting can be done using this technique by spammers or attackers.

signature.shortDescription: Log of what the user typed inside a bash shell.
signature.textualDescription: Log of what the user typed inside a bash shell.
This search reveals userlists of administrative importance. Userlists found using this method can range from benign "message group" lists to system userlists containing passwords.
This search reveals userlists of administrative importance. Userlists found using this method can range from benign "message group" lists to system userlists containing passwords.

signature.shortDescription: Log of what the user typed inside a shell.
signature.textualDescription: Log of what the user typed inside a shell.

signature.textualDescription: Reveals web pathnames and php filenames
An Informix error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial code. Possible source code disclosure.
Another SQL error message, this message can display the username, database, path names and partial SQL code. Possible source code disclosure.

signature.querystring: "An illegal character has been found in the statement" -"previous message"
signature.textualDescription: An Informix error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial code, all of which are very helpful for hackers...
Another SQL error message, this message can display database name, path names and partial SQL code, all of which are very helpful for hackers...

signature.textualDescription: Possible information disclosure attacker against Chatologica.
A DB2 error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames, partial code and program state.
This error message can reveal information such as compiler used, language used, line numbers, program names and partial source code.
An SQL Server error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial code, all of which are very helpful for hackers...
An SQL Server error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial code, all of which are very helpful for hackers...
An Oracle error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial SQL code.

signature.textualDescription: An PostgreSQL error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial code.

signature.textualDescription: An SQL Server error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial code.

signature.querystring: "Warning: Cannot modify header information - headers already sent"
signature.textualDescription: A PHP error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial code, all of which are very helpful for hackers...
A DB2 error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames, partial code and program state, all of which are very helpful for hackers...

signature.shortDescription: Gives some interesting information about web sites
signature.textualDescription: These aren't too horribly bad, but there are SO MANY of them. These sites got googlebotted while the site was having "technical difficulties." The resulting cached error message gives lots of juicy tidbits about the target site.

signature.shortDescription: Gives out some source code information
signature.textualDescription: This is an ASP error message that can reveal information such as compiler used, language used, line numbers, program names and partial source code.

signature.querystring: intitle:"the page cannot be found" inetmgr
signature.textualDescription: IIS 4.0 servers. Extrememly old, incredibly easy to hack...

signature.querystring: intitle:"the page cannot be found" "internet information services"
signature.textualDescription: This query finds various types of IIS servers. This error message is fairly indicative of a somewhat unmodified IIS server, meaning it may be easier to break into...

signature.shortDescription: Reveals the type of web server running by the site
signature.textualDescription: This one shows the type of web server running on the site, and has the ability to show other information depending on how the message is internally formatted.

signature.shortDescription: Narrows OS and wev server version
signature.textualDescription: This error message can be used to narrow down the operating system and web server version which can be used by hackers to mount a specific attack.

signature.querystring: "supplied argument is not a valid MySQL result resource"
signature.shortDescription: Provides path names inside the webserver
signature.textualDescription: Potential interesting information from this error message . The results of this message give you real path names inside the webserver as well as more php scripts for potential "crawling" activities.
Another error message, this appears when an SQL query bails. This is a generic mySQL message, so there's all sort of information hackers can use, depending on the actual error message...
Another generic SQL message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial SQL code, all of which are very helpful for hackers...

signature.shortDescription: Provides path names and partial database code
signature.textualDescription: A generic ORACLE error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial database code.

signature.shortDescription: Shows a naive web site builder
signature.textualDescription: This is a default directory for the sitebuilder web design software program.

signature.textualDescription: This is a default directory for the sitebuilder web design software program. If these people posted web pages with default sitebuilder directory names.

signature.querystring: "Supplied argument is not a valid PostgreSQL result"
signature.shortDescription: Displays function names, filename, source code
signature.textualDescription: An PostgreSQL error message, this message can display path names, function names, filenames and partial code, all of which are very helpful for hackers...

signature.shortDescription: This error message reveals interesting information
signature.textualDescription: Sablotron is an XML tool. This query hones in on error messages generated by this toolkit. These error messages reveal all sorts of interesting informaion such as source code snippets, path and filename info, etc.

signature.querystring: intitle:"the page cannot be found" "2004 microsoft corporation"
signature.textualDescription: Windows 2000 web servers are usually weak spots.

signature.querystring: "Welcome to phpMyAdmin" AND " Create new database"
signature.shortDescription: give access to phpMyAdmin to maintain SQL
signature.textualDescription: phpMyAdmin is a widly spread webfrontend used to mantain sql databases. The default security mechanism is to leave it up to the admin of the website to put a .htaccess file in the directory of the application.
These pages indicate that they are sharing the C:\WINDOWS directory, which is the system folder for many Windows installations.
This directory has various personal documents and pictures.
This query reveals backup directories. These directories can contain various information ranging from source code, sql tables, userlists, and even passwords.

signature.shortDescription: Reveals back up directories with juicy stuff
signature.textualDescription: Backup directories are good targets for information gathering.

signature.shortDescription: Potential access to a protected direcroty.
signature.textualDescription: Potential access to a protected direcroty.
Potential access to a "secure" directory.
Potential access to a "secure" directory.
Potential access to a "secure" directory.

The \WINNT directory is the directory that Windows NT is installed into by default. Now just because google can find them, this doesn't necessarily mean that these are Windows NT directories that made their way onto the web. However, sometimes this happens.

signature.querystring: "Select a database to view" intitle:"filemaker pro"
signature.textualDescription: This search locates servers which provides access to Filemaker pro databases via the web. The severity of this search varies wildly depending on the security of the database itself.

signature.shortDescription: Intranet should not be accessible from the internet.
signature.textualDescription: Potential access to an internal site.

signature.shortDescription: Searches defaults installation of postnuke CMS system
signature.textualDescription: This finds default installations of the postnuke CMS system. In many cases, default installations can be insecure especially considering that the administrator hasn't gotten past the first few installation steps.

signature.shortDescription: This Bulletin board has SQL injection vulnerability
signature.textualDescription: Yet Another Bulletin Board (YABB) SE (versions 1.5.4 and 1.5.5 and perhaps others) contain an SQL injection vulnerability which may allow several attacks including unauthorized database modification or viewing. See http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9674

signature.shortDescription: Pages with install/install.php may be insecure
signature.textualDescription: Pages with install/install.php files may be in the process of installing a new service or program. These servers may be insecure due to insecure default settings. In some cases, these servers may allow for a new installation of a program or service with insecure settings. In other cases, snapshot data about an install process can be gleaned from cached page images.

signature.shortDescription: Gallery config mode allows changes in gallery
signature.textualDescription: Gallery configuration mode allows outsiders to make changes to your gallery.

signature.shortDescription: Vulnerable to ../ and many other bugs
signature.textualDescription: These servers can be messed with in many ways. One specific way is by way of the "../" bug. This lets you cruise around the web server in a somewhat limited fashion.

This is a decent way to explore the admin interface of osCommerce e-commerce sites. Depending on how bad the setup of the web store is, web surfers can even Google their way into customer details and order status, all from the Google cache.

Microsoft Remote Desktop Connection Web Connection pages. These pages are not necessarily insecure, sine many layers of security can be wrapped around the actual use of this service, but simply being able to find these in Google gives hackers an informational advantage, and many of the sites are not implemented securely. In the worst case scenario these pages may allow an attacker to bypass a firewall gaining access to an otherwise inaccessible machine.

signature.shortDescription: MS Terminal services web connector pages
signature.textualDescription: Microsoft Terminal Services Web Connector pages. These pages are not necessarily insecure, sine many layers of security can be wrapped around the actual use of this service, but simply being able to find these in Google gives hackers an informational advantage, and many of the sites are not implemented securely. In the worst case scenario these pages may allow an attacker to bypass a firewall gaining access to a "protected" machine.

From http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9664, the AllMyPHP family of products (Versions 0.1.2 - 0.4) contains several potential vulnerabilities, som elalowing an attacker to execute malicious code on the web server.

From http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9664, the AllMyPHP family of products (Versions 0.1.2 - 0.4) contains several potential vulnerabilities, som elalowing an attacker to execute malicious code on the web server.

signature.shortDescription: MS Terminal services multiple clients pages
signature.textualDescription: Microsoft Terminal Services Multiple Clients pages. These pages are not necessarily insecure, sine many layers of security can be wrapped around the actual use of this service, but simply being able to find these in Google gives hackers an informational advantage, and many of the sites are not implemented securely.

signature.shortDescription: Version 3.0.0 candidate 4 and below have vulnerabilites
signature.textualDescription: Version 3.0.0 candidate 4 and earlier of Vbulletin may have a cross-site scripting vulnerability. See http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/9656

signature.querystring: "seeing this instead" intitle:"test page for apache"
signature.shortDescription: Helps to determine the version of the web page
signature.textualDescription: This is the default web page for Apache 1.3.11 - 1.3.26. Hackers can use this information to determine the version of the web server, or to search Google for vulnerable targets. In addition, this indicates that the web server is not well maintained.
Xerox printers on the internet. Google found these printers.

signature.shortDescription: Default installation of Netscape Fastrack server is insecure
signature.textualDescription: This finds default installations of Netscape Fasttrack Server. In many cases, default installations can be insecure especially considering that the administrator hasn't gotten past the first few installation steps.
Manuals indicate a default Apache web root. This is not a security best practice.
Default installs are not secure.

signature.shortDescription: Could be used to lock administrators out.
signature.textualDescription: These printers are on the Internet.

This is the default web page for Apache 1.2.6 - 1.3.9. Hackers can use this information to determine the version of the web server, or to search Google for vulnerable targets. In addition, this indicates that the web server is not well maintained.

signature.querystring: intitle:"Test Page for Apache" "It Worked!" "on this web"
signature.textualDescription: This is the default web page for Apache 1.2.6 - 1.3.9. Hackers can use this information to determine the version of the web server, or to search Google for vulnerable targets. In addition, this indicates that the web server is not well maintained.

signature.textualDescription: This is a way to find Cisco products with an open web interface. These are generally supposed to be user and password protected.
